meanings.definition: Admitting or acknowledging a crime or wrongdoing.
meanings.sent1: The confessed thief returned the stolen items.
meanings.sent2: The police caught the confessed criminal red-handed.
meanings.sent3: The confessed student sheepishly returned the borrowed pencil.
meanings.sent4: Her confessed guilt weighed heavily on her conscience.
meanings.sent5: The confessed mistake led to a valuable life lesson.

meanings.definition: Stating or declaring something openly or freely.
meanings.sent1: She confessed her love for him under the starry sky.
meanings.sent2: He confessed his true feelings to his best friend.
meanings.sent3: The comedian confessed his hilarious secret on stage.
meanings.sent4: The author confessed his deepest thoughts in his book.
meanings.sent5: The singer confessed her emotions through her powerful lyrics.
